name: Kigali Genocide Memorial
description: The final resting place of over 250,000 victims of the 1994 Genocide against the Tutsi. Features permanent exhibitions, memorial gardens, and an education center.

name: Murambi Genocide Memorial
description: Located at the former Murambi Technical School in Nyamagabe District, this memorial preserves the memory of approximately 50,000 victims.

name: Nyamata Genocide Memorial Church
description: A former Catholic church where thousands of Tutsi sought refuge. Now preserved as a memorial with victims' belongings and documentation.

name: Ntarama Genocide Memorial Church
description: Another church site where over 5,000 Tutsi were killed. Preserved with personal belongings and educational displays.

name: Ethnographic Museum (National Museum of Rwanda)
description: Rwanda's oldest museum, showcasing the country's cultural heritage including traditional crafts, musical instruments, and historical artifacts.

name: King's Palace Museum (Rukali)
description: A reconstructed traditional royal residence in Nyanza, offering insights into pre-colonial Rwandan monarchy and traditions.

name: Campaign Against Genocide Museum
description: Located in the former parliament building in Kigali, documenting the history of the genocide and the RPF's campaign to stop it.

name: Bisesero Genocide Memorial
description: Commemorates the resistance of Tutsi at Bisesero hill in Karongi District, where thousands fought back against genocide perpetrators.
